title: Suspect involved in three-wheeler robbery arrested with ‘Ice’
byline: A suspect involved in the robbery of a three-wheeler has been arrested by the Ragama Police while in possession of ‘Ice’ (crystal methamphetamine) drugs.

title: Magnitude 6.5 earthquake strikes Colombia
byline: A magnitude 6.5 earthquake struck Columbia on Sunday, the German Research Centre for Geosciences (GFZ) said.

title: Showery conditions to enhance from tomorrow
byline: Showery condition is expected to enhance in the southwestern part of the island from June 10th, with strong wind gust over the island and in the sea areas around the island, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Suspect arrested with smuggled cigarettes at BIA
byline: An individual has been arrested at the arrival terminal of Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake for smuggling a total of 7,600 sticks of foreign-made cigarettes (28 cartons).

title: California governor calls Trump National Guard deployment in LA unlawful
byline: California National Guard troops were deployed to the streets of Los Angeles on Sunday to help quell a third day of protests over President Donald Trump’s immigration enforcement, as the state’s Democratic governor called their deployment unlawful.

title: Veterinary surgeons launch token strike
byline: The State Veterinary Surgeons’ Association has launched a token strike today (09).

title: Ex-Minister Udaya Gammanpila appears before CID
byline: Former Minister Udaya Gammanpila appeared before the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) this morning (June 9) to record a statement.

title: Govt. to recruit 10,000 retired military personnel into police service
byline: The Ministry of Public Security of Sri Lanka has announced plans to recruit 10,000 individuals under the age of 45 who have legally retired from active military service into the police force.

title: Trump-Musk row heightens fears over Nasa budget cuts
byline: The row between US President Donald Trump and billionaire Elon Musk over a major spending bill has exacerbated uncertainty over the future of Nasa’s budget, which was already facing deep cuts.

title: No mask mandate for now and no need for mass COVID testing: PHI Union chief
byline: Although there is no legal requirement for the general public to wear a mask at present, any persons can consider wearing one if they feel that they could be exposed to the SARS-CoV-2 virus which causes the COVID-19 disease, the President of the Public Health Inspector’s Union of Sri Lanka Upul Rohana said.

title: Several senior Police officers transferred with NPC approval
byline: Several senior gazzeted officers have been transferred and appointed to new positions with immediate effect, the Police headquarters has announced.

title: Israeli forces seize Gaza-bound aid boat and detain Greta Thunberg and other activists
byline: Israeli forces seized a Gaza-bound aid boat and detained Greta Thunberg and other activists who were on board early Monday, enforcing a longstanding blockade of the Palestinian territory that has been tightened during the war with Hamas.

title: Ex-Minister Udaya Gammanpila leaves CID after recording statement
byline: Former Minister Udaya Gammanpila left the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) a short while ago after recording a statement, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Bangladesh demands explanation from Sri Lanka over visa-on-arrival
byline: Suspension of both-way on-arrival visa issuance for the citizens of Bangladesh and Sri Lanka is still in force as Dhaka is still waiting to get clarification from Colombo, according to media reports from Bangladesh.

title: 10-hour water cut in several areas on Wednesday
byline: A 10-hour water cut will be imposed in several areas in the Gampaha District on Wednesday (June 11), the National Water Supply & Drainage Board (NWSDB) announced.

title: Medical Laboratory Technologist and trade union activist Ravi Kumudesh suspended from duty
byline: Medical Laboratory Technologist and prominent trade union activist Ravi Kumudesh has been suspended from duty for violating the Establishments Code by contesting at the 2024 Parliamentary Election.

title: Explosion on Singapore-flagged ship heading to Mumbai from Colombo
byline: An explosion has been reported on board the Singapore-flagged container ship MV Wan Hai 503 off the coast of Kerala, India today (09).

title: ASPI hits new all-time high as market surges
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange closed at an all-time high today (09), after making significant gains before trading closed.

title: Mahindananda’s lawyers file appeal over prison sentence
byline: Former Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage’s lawyers have filed an appeal before the Supreme Court against the sentence imposed by the Colombo High Court in May.

title: 15 university students killed in bus crash in Malaysia
byline: A fatal crash that claimed the lives of 15 students is being investigated on the orders of Malaysia Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim.

title: Significant boost in state revenue recorded in first four months of 2025: CBSL
byline: A significant increase in state revenue has been recorded during the first four months of 2025, according to data released by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL).

title: Derana continues media sponsorship of National Poson Festival for 16th consecutive year
byline: The Derana Media Network will provide media sponsorship for this year’s National Poson Festival being held in Anuradhapura.

title: SLTB to deploy 150 buses to Anuradhapura for Poson Festival
byline: The Sri Lanka Transport Board has decided to deploy an additional 150 buses for the convenience of the devotees visiting Anuradhapura for the National Poson Festival.

title: Cabinet decides to send Commissioner General of Prisons on compulsory leave
byline: A decision has been taken by the Cabinet of Ministers to send Commissioner General of Prisons, Thushara Upuldeniya on compulsory leave.

title: Bribery Commission to question ‘Harak Kata’ after court ruling
byline: The Colombo High Court today ordered the Terrorism Investigation Division (TID) to facilitate the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption in obtaining a statement from notorious underworld figure Nadun Chithaka Wickremeratne, alias ‘Harak Kata’, who is currently being detained under the Prevention of Terrorism Act.
